answers.answer: Well I wasn't a first time mom, but it was my first time being induced. They started the drip at 10am and I had her at 6:55pm, no hard labor until 2pm though.
With my first I was induced at 8am and was already 2cm dialated, had my son at 1:58am.

It'll depend on how ready your body and the baby is. There is no magical number. I've been induced three times. First time was about 16hrs from the start of pitocen to delivery. Second I was on cervidil to soften my cervix and then it was about 10hrs from start of pitocen till delivery. Third again on cervidil overnight and then about 12hrs from start of pitocen until delivery.

With my second pregnancy I was 12 days late and had not dilated, so mine started with softening my cervix overnight, at 7am they started the patosin, 8am my water was broken and I gave birth just after 10am
I've been induced with all of mine, first took 20 hours, second 9, third 12, so it just depends on your body
It really depends on each women. My body didn't respond to pitocin after 3 days of trying... And I was 2.5 weeks late

Thanks for the info! We are both excited and so is our families. Everyone keeps asking me how long an induction takes and I keep telling them it depends on the person :) we have family coming from a few hours away so they wanted to make sure they arrived before our daughter does.

With my first I was induced at 2 weeks overdue. They spent two days trying various methods and finally used a kind of catheter-water balloon device to push my cervix open. My left side was refusing to thin out or what have you so my cervix couldn't dilate.The induction itself was really pretty easy and painless, the labor itself was freaking torture but I figured as much with an overdue baby.

question: I am a first time mom and I am being induced at 37 weeks due to gestational hypertension and gestational diabetes. December 18th I will be going into the hospital that night to be induced and I was curious if any other women who were first time moms were induced and how long did it take?  I have not been checked for dilation or anything yet but my baby has dropped drastically over the last week.  Any feed back would be great! Thanks Ladies!!
title: How long does an induction take?
